taxon_name.authority: Kunth in A. von Humboldt et al.

place_of_publication.publication_title: in A. von Humboldt et al., Nov. Gen. Sp.

bio:treatment.description: mm; petals white, 8–11 × 2–3 mm; corona filament whorls 1, filaments purple basally, yellow-white apically, linear, terete, sometimes clavate, 5–11 mm. Berries green to green-white, ovoid-fusiform, 35–45 × 20–25 mm. 2n = 12.
bio:treatment.discussion: J. M. Coulter (1890, 1891) reported Passiflora bryonioides (as the synonym P. inamoena A. Gray) from Hidalgo, Texas; that specimen may now be lost or it may have been misidentified. The nearest to southernmost Texas this species is confirmed to occur is about 500 km to the southwest (J. M. MacDougal 1994).
